member.name: T:LorIdExtensions.LorName
member.summary: An equivalent of for string names instead of int ids.

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorName.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a LorName given either a simple name (in which case the package id will be empty), or a compressed form of a LorName (in which case the package id will be recovered).
member.param: The name to construct a LorName by.

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorName.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a "generic custom" LorName for addressing modded entities that nevertheless do not belong to any mod that has a package id. (most notably, standalone external skins)
member.param: The name to construct a LorName by.
to construct a "generic custom" LorName (if , the default constructor is used).

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorName.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a LorName given a package id and an internal name. NOTE: if the given name is already a compressed form of a LorName, its package id will be recovered and used instead!

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorName.Compress
member.summary: Compresses a LorName into a single string of the form "packageId:internalName", or just the internal name if package id is empty.
member.returns: The compressed form of the LorName.

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorName.IsCompressed(System.String)
member.summary: Checks whether a given string is a valid compressed form of a LorName. That is, whether it is not and contains the separator character ":".
member.returns: if the given name is a valid compressed form of a LorName, otherwise .

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorName.IsWorkshopGeneric
member.summary: Tests whether the LorName is a "generic custom" identifier (see ).
member.returns: if this LorName is a "generic custom" LorName, otherwise .

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorName.IsWorkshopGenericId(System.String)
member.summary: Tests whether the given package id corresponds to a "generic custom" identifier (see ).
member.returns: if the given package id corresponds to a "generic custom" identifier, otherwise .

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorName.MakeLorNameLegacy(LorIdExtensions.LorNameXml,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a LorName for "legacy" applications that need to default to empty package id on empty (instead of using the default id in that case). Thus, instead of substituting the default package id for empty/missing xml package id (as / do), it is only substituted if the xml package id is "@this". (see also: )
member.param: The LorName xml from which to create a legacy LorName.

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorName.InitializeLorNamesLegacy(System.Collections.Generic.List{LorIdExtensions.LorNameXml},System.Collections.Generic.List{LorIdExtensions.LorName},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a list of LorName for "legacy" applications that need to default to empty package id on empty (instead of using the default id in that case). Thus, instead of substituting the default package id for empty/missing xml package id (as / do), it is only substituted if the xml package id is "@this". (see also: )
member.param: The list of LorName xmls from which to create legacy LorName values.
The list of LorName into which the results should be placed.

member.name: T:LorIdExtensions.LorIdLegacy
member.summary: The class for handling "legacy" LorId xml fields that preserve empty package id.

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorIdLegacy.MakeLorIdLegacy(ILorIdXml,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a LorId for "legacy" applications that need to default to empty package id on empty (instead of using the default id in that case). Thus, instead of substituting the default package id for empty/missing xml package id (as does), it is only substituted if the xml package id is "@this".
member.param: The LorId xml from which to create a legacy LorId.

member.name: M:LorIdExtensions.LorIdLegacy.InitializeLorIdsLegacy``1(System.Collections.Generic.List{``0},System.Collections.Generic.List{LorId},System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a list of LorId for "legacy" applications that need to default to empty package id on empty (instead of using the default id in that case). Thus, instead of substituting the default package id for empty/missing xml package id (as does), it is only substituted if the xml package id is "@this".
member.param: The list of LorId xmls from which to create legacy LorId values.
The list of LorId into which the results should be placed.
